5.title: Le Docteur Festus.
5.author: [No author]
notes: "Dans ce cahier sont représentés au naturel les voyages et aventures du docteur Festus, combinés avec les infortunes du maire, les manoeuvres de la force armée, et les faits concernant milord et son épouse ... Autographié par l'auteur.
Lith. de Schmidt cie."
Title page lacking ; apparent first edition of this work by Rodolphe Töpffer, cf. reprint ed. published by Seuil in 1996.

6.title: Le Docteur Festus ; Histoire de Monsieur Cryptogame : deux odyssées

Reprints with new introduction by Thierry Groensteen. Originally published (1st work): Paris, 1840. (2nd work): Genève, 1845.

Chapter 3: Welcome to Resort! ; chapter 4: The Right of Possession! ; Chapter 5: Come Out and Fight!
Begins: As passengers on a U.F.O., w-we must.

135.heading: Doctor Cyborg.
135.title: The Clone Conspiracy
135.author: uncovered, verified and written by Allan Gross ; art by Mark Wheatley, Marc Hempel and Damon Willis.
notes: ca. 200 p. : ill. ; 26 cm.
"Some of the material in this book originally appeared in issues 1-5 of the comic book series Doctor Cyborg."

Summary: "This action adventure story proves once and for all that the secret of cloning arose from an ancient civilization, passing through the hands of Moses, Jesus, the mysterious man known as Shakespeare and even John F. Kennedy before falling into the possession of a splinter group of the Freemasons. Hidden ciphers lead to a trail of treachery, murder and deceit that infected the superpower governments of the Cold War, corrupted pious religious leaders and spawned a scientific and academic Mafia that jealously guarded our society's most terrible secret."

138.title: Le Docteur Festus
notes: Story rendered both in prose and in comics by Rodolphe Töpffer
